citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A gouldian finch was observed to be on the perch holding one leg up and hesitant to walk. A facility representative
handled it for a closer look and its left leg was turned inward with a swollen/scabbed area over the ankle region. Facility
representatives and the VMO that saw it closer agreed that it appeared to be a broken leg.
The scab appeared to be more than 24 hours old and indicates the injury occurred before the daily observation that was
performed the morning of the inspection. This condition had not been identified prior to inspection and the animal had not
been under treatment. Leg injuries such as these can be painful and must be promptly recognized so that animals can
receive treatment. Ensure that a routine of adequate daily observations is in place so that health problems and injuries are
recognized and veterinary treatment can be initiated.
***This bird's condition was communicated with the AV and the animal received treatment.
***Ensure to maintain correct from December 12, 2025.

The rabbits' group housing do not meet the minimum space requirement for 14 in height. Additionally, three group
enclosures (26x45 in) with total floor space of 8.125 square feet housed 7 to 9 rabbits each. The maximum number of
rabbits that could be housed in this sized enclosure to meet the minimum space requirements is 5 rabbits. Inadequate
floor space can cause health problems and discomfort. Ensure the rabbits' housing meets the minimum space
requirements per this subpart.
***Correct by December 29, 2025.

Approximately 5 primary enclosures housing about 40-50 budgerigars each were lacking enough space for each bird
make normal postural and social adjustments. Each cage had 2-3 perches with tightly arranged rows of birds and several
(about 10-20) birds resting on the floor of the enclosure. The remaining space on the perch would not have been able to
comfortably contain all the animals.
The normal behavior of a budgerigar is to rest on a perch, unless eating or drinking. Observing several animals resting on
the floor while the perches are nearly full is abnormal behavior for the animals and indicates inadequate space, which can
lead to psychological and physical health issues for the animals.
Correct by ensuring each bird can make normal postural and social adjustments including perching comfortably.
***Correct by December 29, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Alexandra Friedman n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A gouldian finch was observed to be on the perch holding one leg up and hesitant to walk. A facility representative 
handled it for a closer look and its left leg was turned inward with a swollen/scabbed area over the ankle region. Facility 
representatives and the VMO that saw it closer agreed that it appeared to be a broken leg.  
 
The scab appeared to be more than 24 hours old and indicates the injury occurred before the daily observation that was 
performed the morning of the inspection. This condition had not been identified prior to inspection and the animal had not 
been under treatment. Leg injuries such as these can be painful and must be promptly recognized so that animals can 
receive treatment. Ensure that a routine of adequate daily observations is in place so that health problems and injuries are 
recognized and veterinary treatment can be initiated.  
***This bird's condition was communicated with the AV and the animal received treatment.  
***Ensure to maintain correct from December 12, 2025. 
3.53(c)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The rabbits' group housing do not meet the minimum space requirement for 14 in height. Additionally, three group 
enclosures (26x45 in) with total floor space of 8.125 square feet housed 7 to 9 rabbits each. The maximum number of 
rabbits that could be housed in this sized enclosure to meet the minimum space requirements is 5 rabbits. Inadequate 
floor space can cause health problems and discomfort. Ensure the rabbits' housing meets the minimum space 
requirements per this subpart. 
***Correct by December 29, 2025. 
3.153(b) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Approximately 5 primary enclosures housing about 40-50 budgerigars each were lacking enough space for each bird 
make normal postural and social adjustments. Each cage had 2-3 perches with tightly arranged rows of birds and several 
(about 10-20) birds resting on the floor of the enclosure. The remaining space on the perch would not have been able to 
comfortably contain all the animals.

The normal behavior of a budgerigar is to rest on a perch, unless eating or drinking. Observing several animals resting on 
the floor while the perches are nearly full is abnormal behavior for the animals and indicates inadequate space, which can 
lead to psychological and physical health issues for the animals.  
 
Correct by ensuring each bird can make normal postural and social adjustments including perching comfortably.  
 
***Correct by December 29, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Alexandra Friedman n
